Key Match Events: Gerrit Cole intentionally walked Rafael Devers in the fourth inning, leading to a seven-run inning for the Red Sox.
The Red Sox scored seven runs against Gerrit Cole after the intentional walk.
Masataka Yoshida hit an RBI ground-rule double.
Wilyer Abreu added a two-run single.
Pre-Game Insights: Gerrit Cole and manager Aaron Boone discussed being more aggressive with walking Rafael Devers in certain situations before the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Gerrit Cole admitted that the decision to walk Devers was a mistake and it affected his performance.
Aaron Boone acknowledged that he did not communicate well enough about attacking Devers.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora believed Cole intentionally hit Devers in his first at-bat to avoid facing him.
Rafael Devers was surprised by the intentional walk and felt Cole panicked.
